selected_quotes: .@JeffersonUniv research shows endogenous presentation of antigens drives most CD4+ T cell responses in mice w/flu: htt…
Alternative way of processing viral antigens by APC could change vaccine design strategies
.@JeffersonUniv research shows endogenous presentation of antigens drives most CD4+ T cell responses in mice w/flu
Further understanding of how APC process viral antigens could change vaccine design strategies

citation.abstract: By convention, CD4(+) T lymphocytes recognize foreign and self peptides derived from internalized antigens in combination with major histocompatibility complex class II molecules. Alternative pathways of epitope production have been identified, but their contributions to host defense have not been established. We show here in a mouse infection model that the CD4(+) T cell response to influenza, critical for durable protection from the virus, is driven principally by unconventional processing of antigen synthesized within the infected antigen-presenting cell, not by classical processing of endocytosed virions or material from infected cells. Investigation of the cellular components involved, including the H2-M molecular chaperone, the proteasome and γ-interferon-inducible lysosomal thiol reductase revealed considerable heterogeneity in the generation of individual epitopes, an arrangement that ensures peptide diversity and broad CD4(+) T cell engagement. These results could fundamentally revise strategies for rational vaccine design and may lead to key insights into the induction of autoimmune and anti-tumor responses.
citation.title: Endogenous antigen processing drives the primary CD4(+) T cell response to influenza.

news.title: Flu infection reveals many paths to immune response
news.summary: A new study of influenza infection in an animal model broadens understanding of how the immune system responds to flu virus, showing that the process is more dynamic than usually described, engaging a broader array of biological pathways.

facebook.title: Endogenous antigen processing drives the primary CD4+ T cell response to influenza
facebook.summary: CD4+ T cell responses are classically induced by presentation of exogenous antigens by antigen-presenting cells. The authors of a new study report that endogenous presentation drives most CD4+ T cell responses in influenza-infected mice.

facebook.title: Endogenous antigen processing drives the primary CD4+ T cell response to influenza
facebook.summary: In a mouse infection model, the CD4+ T cell response to influenza, critical for durable protection from the virus, is driven mainly by unconventional processing of antigen synthesized within the infected antigen-presenting cell.
